title: What's News: World-Wide — WSJ
text:
This article is being republished as part of our daily reproduction of WSJ.com articles that also appeared in the U.S. print edition of The Wall Street Journal (September 23, 2019).

Trump confirmed that he discussed Biden with Ukraine's president during a July call, as some senior Democrats stepped up calls for impeachment hearings.

The president is likely to face an uphill battle in mobilizing international pressure against Iran at the U.N. over Tehran's alleged Saudi attack.

A GOP stronghold in Atlanta's suburbs has been transformed by an influx of minorities, creating a possible Democratic juggernaut.

Casino owner Adelson warned Trump that an escalating trade war with China could hurt the U.S. economy and his re-election bid.

A tropical storm could hit Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands this week.

Egypt braced for more unrest after two nights of hundreds were arrested in protests calling for Sisi's removal.

A peaceful rally turned into a battle scene, after Hong Kong riot police responded and protesters built barricades and lighted fires.

Israel's Arab parties backed Gantz as prime minister in an attempt to oust Netanyahu.

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

September 23, 2019 02:47 ET (06:47 GMT)
